testCases.explanation: String '321' encodes array [3,2,1]. Centered subarrays (odd-length, center > all others): [3,2,1] has center 2, but 2<3 so not centered. Single elements are trivially centered: [3],[2],[1]=3, plus any 3-length: center must be max. None qualify in this array for length>1. Or check: length-1 subarrays always centered = 3, but problem may require length>=3.
Array [1,3,2]. Subarray [1,3,2]: center=3 > 1 and 3 > 2. Yes! 1 centered subarray of length 3.
Array [1,1,1]. No element is strictly greater than its neighbors. 0 centered subarrays of length >= 3.

description: Given a string `s` where each character is a digit representing an array element, count the number of **centered subarrays**. A subarray of odd length is centered if its middle element is strictly greater than all other elements in the subarray.

examples.explanation: Array [1,3,2]. The subarray [1,3,2] has center 3 > 1 and 3 > 2. Count=1.
No element is strictly greater than its neighbors.
